Making a Two Oscillator Instrument

In this instrument we will combine the sound of two oscillators.

  1. If the "WhizzyOrgan" instrument is not already open then click on the "Edit" button on the "17. Drawbar Organ" line.
  2. Uncheck the "Phase Mod" button (near top left) if checked. This means the modOsc and mainOsc will be mixed together and not used for FM (actually phase modulation).
  3. Click "Play Keys" and play the "A" key.
  4. Check the "Repeat Last Note" box so it keeps playing.
  5. In the mainOsc area, click on the "Square" wave form and select "Sawtooth". Notice the tone change.
  6. Change the "phaseModDepth fader. That will change the mix level for the modOsc oscillator.
  7. Uncheck the "Repeat Last Note" box so it stops playing.
  8. In the modOsc area, check the "Semis" button so that we can enter a semitone offset.
  9. In the text box enter 7. Notice it turns red. That means it has not been entered yet. Hit ENTER to finish changing the value.
  10. Click "Play Keys", play the keyboard, and notice the instrument now has two tones tuned 7 semitones, or a fifth, apart.
